intro: Buchnera juncea, commonly known as the slender bugseed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and streambanks. Buchnera juncea is often found in the northern United States and southern Canada.
